action.action-desc: Ms. Houlahan (for herself, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Meijer, and Mrs. Luria) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to prohibit the export or sale of petroleum products from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to certain entities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Banning Oil Exports to Foreign Adversaries Act.

subsection.text: The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended by inserting after section 163 (42 U.S.C. 6243) the following:
The Secretary shall prohibit the export or sale of petroleum products drawn down from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, under any provision of law, to—

paragraph.text: the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea;
any other country the government of which is subject to sanctions imposed by the United States; and
any entity owned, controlled, or influenced by—

subparagraph.text: a country referred to in any of paragraphs (1) through (5); or

subsection.text: The Secretary may issue a waiver of the prohibition described in subsection (a) if the Secretary certifies that any export or sale authorized pursuant to the waiver is in the national security interests of the United States.
Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of the Banning Oil Exports to Foreign Adversaries Act, the Secretary shall issue a rule to carry out this section.
